channel.title: How much should I sell this laptop for?
channel.description:
I'm not the best at pricing laptops, so hopefully someone here can help! Here's is some info on the laptop (not specs)
It's an HP, all black, a very nice and smooth look and style to it. It's in very decent condition, the normal wear and tear of having a laptop.
More in-depth on the condition: - Some of the stickers were peeled off, but if they were to be cleaned and have the sticky shit removed, you wouldn't know they were there. - The screen has no scratches, blemishes, or anything. - The top of the laptop has minor (surface) scratches. - No missing keys or broken keys on the keyboard.
Some of the specs: - Very nice high resolution, and wide, screen. It's a 17.1" - I don't have the charger yet, so I can't boot it up, but from removing the covers, and checking, this laptop has 4GB RAM, and a 120gb HDD. - Two hard drives can be installed on the laptop. - Webcam and two microphones. - Touch multimedia controls above the keyboard. - Full QWERTY keyboard with a separate numpad. - Touch pad has a little scroll bar on it too!
Ports and whatnot: - PC Card slot (I think that's what it's called.. Don't remember) - 5 In 1 card reader (for SD cards and crap) - VGA ports - 4 x USB 2.0 ports - Modem/Ethernet ports - A firewire port - S-Video Out - Cable docking connector - Microphone input - Two headphone out ports (one with SPDIF)
Other features: - Supports infrared for connecting remote controls. - Lightscribe CD/DVD RW drive. (Lightscribe allows you to automatically etch designs into the top of your CDs) - Wi-fi (of course) - Bluetooth 2.0 (I think..)
So yeah, that's some about it. I got it from a friend with no charger, I just ordered a charger online and it'll be here tomorrow. I'll probably put a fresh install of Windows 7 Pro on it. I plan to post it on Craigslist, but I have no idea what to start it at. I'm not sure of how old it is, but the hard drive is from March 9th, 2007. Any suggestions? Thanks.
Model # is Hp Pavillion Dv9000 - Only reason I didn't just include this before is because there are several different HP Paviliion Dv9000 laptops.
- No blemishes,

item.title: How much should I sell this laptop for?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:14, topic:545427”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=664311.msg4441340#msg4441340 date=1406740186]

sell it for the price you bought it

I can get more than $35 for it, lol.
[/quote]Not much more than that…according to Google the cpu you posted is only about $15-20.

I am shocked you went and bought a battery for it how much did the battery cost you?[/quote]

Not a battery but a charger, the charger was only $10. I’ve landed a much better deal on a $1,200 gaming laptop for $170.

Read full topic
item.source: How much should I sell this laptop for?

item.title: How much should I sell this laptop for?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Justin Bieber:

yeah it’s worth about that if it’s a core2duo. tbh you could probably sell it for that much on ebay right now, so u could easily get a better price if there are kids in your city that want it.

I read it wrong, after getting a charger and booting it up the processor:

AMD Turion 64 x2.

So Dual Core and 64-bit must bump the price up.

Read full topic

item.title: How much should I sell this laptop for?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Justin Bieber:

i’m gonna say £100-£200 then. bit uncertain because i don’t know what cpu it has.

That’s what I was thinking. I bought two laptops for $50 USD (£37) and the older one that I have is a business laptop 17" fairly decent specs that I can easily sell for $50 and get my money back. So whatever I sell this HP for is all profit. The processor, if I remember right is Intel Core 2 Duo 2.6GHz, dual core so it’s not too horrible. It’s a multimedia computer which people in my city love to get for their kids. And college students.

Edit: I went to Gadget[…] forgot the full name… And they said it was $20-$20. Lmao… So if I can sell it for $150 USD (~£110 I think…) I wouldn’t complain.

Read full topic
item.source: How much should I sell this laptop for?

a laptop that doesn’t work… £5 is the best i can do m8

Is it necessary to troll? Where at all did I state that it wasn’t working? It works fine…
[/quote]how do u know it works if you can’t boot it?[/quote]

When I bought it from my friend it had ~5mins of battery life, I logged in, started playing a YouTube video, and it died. So it works 100%.

It’s an HP, all black, a very nice and smooth look and style to it. It’s in very decent condition, the normal wear and tear of having a laptop.

  • Lightscribe CD/DVD RW drive. (Lightscribe allows you to automatically etch designs into the top of your CDs)
  • Wi-fi (of course)

So yeah, that’s some about it. I got it from a friend with no charger, I just ordered a charger online and it’ll be here tomorrow. I’ll probably put a fresh install of Windows 7 Pro on it.
